item.title: India monsoon: Rescuers search for survivors after heavy rains
item.description: Heavy rains have battered India's western coast, leaving dozens dead and prompting mass evacuations.

item.title: Afghanistan curfew imposed as Taliban militants advance
item.description: The government says the measure is to help its forces stop Taliban militants infiltrating cities.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: First gold of Games goes to China's Yang Qian in shooting
item.description: Chinese shooter Yang Qian wins the first gold of the Olympics but has to sing her anthem behind a mask and hang her own medal round her neck.

item.title: China imposes sanctions on US officials
item.description: The sanctions are in response to recent US sanctions on Chinese officials in Hong Kong.

item.title: Baby orca, Toa, dies in New Zealand after failed search for mother
item.description: Toa, a killer whale stranded from his family, had washed ashore on the New Zealand coast.

item.title: Australia Covid: Arrests at anti-lockdown protests
item.description: Thousands take to the streets in Sydney, with further protests in Melbourne and Brisbane.

item.title: 1991 reforms: The year that transformed India
item.description: The BBC looks back at the pivotal moment when India's economy changed forever.

item.title: First Chinese presidential visit to Tibet in 30 years
item.description: Xi Jinping is the first Chinese leader in 30 years to make an official trip to the troubled region.

item.title: China floods: Henan mother dies after saving baby from mudslide
item.description: Rescuers believe she had flung her daughter to safety just as their home in Henan was hit.

item.title: Why is the Great Barrier Reef in trouble? A simple guide
item.description: Australia's natural wonder faces a battle to survive - here's a simple guide.

item.title: Firm fined Â£2.6m for claiming clothes prevent Covid
item.description: Australian activewear company Lorna Jane is branded "exploitative" and "predatory" by a judge.

item.title: India Zomato: Shares of food delivery app soar on market debut
item.description: The firm's stock exchange listing sets the pace for other start-ups that are thriving in the pandemic.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Travelling to an Olympic Games like no other
item.description: The BBC's Mariko Oi reflects on her personal experience of covering the Games during a global pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Was US money used to fund risky research in China?
item.description: What's the row about virus research in China between a prominent Republican and Dr Anthony Fauci?

item.title: Olympic Games Tokyo 2020: India's top medal contenders
item.description: India sends its largest ever contingent to the Tokyo Olympics in the hope of bettering its medals tally.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: Mandira Bedi: What Hindu scriptures say about women at cremations
item.description: Indian actress Mandira Bedi made news for doing her husband's last rites, generally a male preserve.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Does Japan have Covid under control?
item.description: With the Olympics starting today, new Covid cases continue to be reported.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
item.description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Is China's vaccine success waning in Asia?
item.description: Thailand and Indonesia's switch to other Covid jabs has raised questions about Chinese vaccines.

item.title: Covid: Ivermectin, milk among Indonesia's unproven 'cures'
item.description: As Indonesia sees a surge fuelled by the Delta variant, misleading health claims are spreading.
